item.title: In the past 24 hours, there has been a total of $360 million worth of liquidations across the network, with the majority coming from long positions.
item.description: On August 3rd, based on Coinglass data, the total value of liquidations across the entire network in the past 24 hours was $360 million. The amount of long liquidations was $279 million, while the short liquidations reached $80.66 million.

item.title: Public Blockchain Activity Rankings in the Last 7 Days: Solana Maintains the Top Position
item.description: On August 3rd, according to Nansen data, among the top five blockchains in terms of the number of active addresses in the past 7 days are: Solana (22.44 million), the BNB Chain (9.76 million), Base (6.851 million), Tron (5.952 million), and Sei (4.07 million).

item.title: Lugano City Government Assists in Retrieval of Satoshi Nakamoto Memorial Statue Thrown into Lake
item.description: August 3rd. The firm Satoshigallery, which is involved in the planning of the Satoshi Nakamoto sculpture, announced that the Lugano City Government in Switzerland has provided assistance in retrieving the statue of the anonymous creator of Bitcoin, Satoshi Nakamoto, which was thrown into the lake.

item.title: This week, the US Ethereum Spot ETF saw a total net inflow of $1.543 billion.
item.description: On August 3rd, based on Farside's monitoring data, this week the US Ethereum spot ETF witnessed a cumulative net inflow of $154.3 million.

item.title: This week, the U.S. Bitcoin spot ETF saw a cumulative net outflow of $6.429 billion.
item.description: On August 3rd, based on Farside's monitoring data, this week in the US, the Bitcoin spot ETF witnessed a total net outflow of $6.429 billion.

item.title: Trump is actively scouting for the next Federal Reserve Chair with Bostic
item.description: August 3rd: In an interview, the Director of the National Economic Council of the White House, Hassett, stated that President Trump is actively collaborating with Treasury Secretary Benet to look for candidates for the next Chairperson of the Federal Reserve. (FX168)

item.title: SBF Appeal Case Scheduled for Trial in November 2025
item.description: On August 3rd, the FTX creditor representative Sunil posted on social media that the appeal of FTX founder SBF is scheduled to be heard during the week of November 3, 2025, at the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit. SBF was previously convicted of 7 charges in November 2023 and sentenced to 25 years in prison in March 2024.SBF officially filed for an appeal in September 2024, and all the relevant legal documents were submitted by January 2025. The outcome of this hearing will be a crucial milestone in his retrial and potential sentence modification.

item.title: Report: Citi, JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs, and SBI Group Lead Traditional Financial Institutions in Blockchain Strategy
item.description: On August 3rd, as per Cointelegraph, Ripple and CB Insights, in conjunction with the UK Blockchain Technology Center, jointly issued a recent report which indicates that Citigroup, JPMorgan Chase, Goldman Sachs, and Japan's SBI Group have emerged as the most active representatives among traditional financial institutions in supporting blockchain startups.The report highlights that from 2020 to 2024, global banks collectively participated in a total of 345 investments in blockchain companies, with a majority of these focused on early-stage financing. Specifically, Citigroup and Goldman Sachs each completed 18 transactions, taking the lead in the industry. JPMorgan Chase and MUFG closely followed, each making 15 investments.Among them, the "mega financing round" with $100 million or more constitutes a key area of focus for bank deployment. Over the past four years, banks have been involved in a total of 33 such financings, and the funds have mainly flowed to companies specializing in

item.title: Justin Sun's Space Reentry EVA Image Revealed, Smiling and in Good Health
item.description: On August 3rd, based on Blue Origin's live broadcast, the founder of TRON Foundation, Justin Sun, has successfully exited the New Shepard spacecraft. He was smiling and in good health.Justin Sun has just completed a suborbital space flight lasting 10 minutes and 14 seconds and has become one of the few Chinese entrepreneurs to enter space.

item.title: Justin Sun boards Blue Origin and returns to Earth, total spaceflight time 10 minutes and 14 seconds
item.description: August 3rd. Based on Blue Origin's official live streaming, Justin Sun, who is the founder of TRON, boarded the New Shepard and completed a space journey. The crew capsule landed successfully, lasting for 10 minutes and 14 seconds.
